clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Study of CS-3150 as Monotherapy or in Combination With Other Antihypertensive Drug in Japanese Patients With Essential Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: Open-label, Multicenter, Interventional, Dose Titration Study to Assess the Long-term Study of CS-3150 2.5mg and 5mg Alone as Monotherapy or in Combination With Other Antihypertensive Drug in Japanese Patients With Essential Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: To examine antihypertensive effect, pharmacodynamics, and safety of long-term administration of CS-3150 as monotherapy and in combination with calcium channel blocker or renin-angiotensin system inhibitor in patients with essential hypertension.

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in sitting systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: week 0 (baseline) to end of weeks 12, 28, and 52

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in 24-hr ambulatory blood pressure monitoring (ABPM)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: week 0 (baseline) to end of weeks 12, 28, and 52

secondary_outcome.measure: number and severity of adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: week 0 (baseline) to end of weeks 12, 28, and 52

secondary_outcome.measure: number and severity of laboratory abnormalities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: week 0 (baseline) to end of weeks 12, 28, and 52

arm_group.description: CS-3150 2.5mg to 5mg, orally, once daily for 28 or 52 weeks

intervention.description: CS-3150 2.5mg to 5mg, orally, once daily for 28 or 52 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects aged 20 years or older at informed consent
- Subjects with essential hypertension, who do not receive any antihypertensive drugs or receive calcium channel blocker, angiotensin converting enzyme ACE inhibitor, or angiotensin-II receptor blockade ARB during run-in period (Sitting systolic blood pressure SBP ≥ 140 mmHg and < 180 mmHg, Sitting diastolic blood pressure DBP ≥ 90 mmHg and < 110 mmHg, and mean 24hr SBP ≥ 130 and DBP ≥ 80 mmHg)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Secondary hypertension or malignant hypertension
- Diabetes mellitus with albuminuria
- Serum potassium level < 3.5 or ≥ 5.1 mEq/L (≥ 4.8 mEq/L if receive ACE inhibitor, or ARB)
- Reversed day-night life cycle including overnight workers
- estimated glomerular filtration rate eGFR < 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2.
